data.title: Lunch, dinner, take-out & catering!
data.text: The Chicken Parm or Shrimp Mozambique are my favorites for dinner, the wraps & salads are great for lunch. Definitely ask about the daily specials, they've always got something a little different and unique & if you're on a budget they have a $6 menu item daily!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: My family and I had a great dinner here last month. I had the surf & turf dinner; steak was tender and juicy, shrimp was fresh and the Mozambique sauce is great. We all had great meals and will absolutely be back!!

data.title: save room for dessert
data.text: Wonderful small bistro with a great service staff and friendly owner/chef.  Spicy meatloaf sandwich appropriately named.  Wonderful!  According to my better half, best Cesar salad wrap which was very fresh and very tasty.  Save room for the chocolate cake with a cheesecake center. A definite addition to our places to go!

data.title: Nice addition to the Fall River dining scene!
data.text:
Stopped in for a quick Friday night supper. Too hot to consider the outdoor seating, we were encouraged to see two police officers in the dining room having a bite (I figure they've got to know the good spots!). Not at all fancy though they are in a lovely old building, they offer a full bar and a menu that covers all the bases. We split the Chips & Salsa to start. I had the Chicken Mozambique Burrito, a Portuguese twist on an old Mexican favorite. My wife had a Cheeseburger. All very good as was the service. 

This location had been the Bella Restaurant a couple of years ago. The address on their website is correct though the map shows them on Stockton Street. Their listed address, Jeremiah Sullivan Drive is actually a pedestrian only street so your GPS may mislead you. They are actually on the corner of South Main Street and South Frontage Road across from the City Hall. Street parking is tough during the day though the city usually empties out on nights and weekends.

data.title: Triple Crown! Food, service and atmosphere......
data.text: First off , Cav Fall River is a family run business  , actually it is the culmination of the life long dream of the father and supported by the grown children. You can feel the family warmth in the service and in the food. The food is Portugese inspired and is fresh , simple , authentic and delicious we were waited on by the son, Adam, and he was sincere , helpful and super accommodating ( even though he was having a terrible day, his father informed us that his car actually caught on fire the night before and he had just spent a couple of hours on the phone with the insurance company. That would be enough to make a person miserable, but instead he was awesome! )The music was both relaxed and contemporary and the walls are covered with paintings by local artists. This place is an absolute must go .The Portugese steak is to die for and when you top it off with a signature cocktail, you will be in heaven. And the prices are extremely reasonable and there is take out service if you want.Cav Fall River is located across from the government building and there is plenty of parking on the street.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: We enjoyed a delicious meal at CAV, outdoor on the patio. We had the mussels as an appetizer which were the best we have had in a long time, the broth was super yummy soaked up in the toasted Portuguese bread. For lunch we both had the chicken Mozambique burrito. The flavor us so different and memorable, in a very good way. Would definitely  come back again.

data.title: A nice surprise in Fall River,,,
data.text: My wife and I headed to Fall River for a concert at the Narrows Center and enjoyed a wonderful meal at CAV Restaurant.  The staff/owners were very cordial, relaxed and helpful with the menu selections. We stared off with a CAV Quesadilla and Kale soup as appetizers along with a bottle of a California chardonnay ($12).  Both apps were tasty and the wine was a dry white suitable for seafood.  My wife got the stuffed shrimp in a white sauce, mixed vegetables and rice that she enjoyed except the vegetables were a little bland.   I ordered The CAV that consisted of seared scallops and caviar in a white sauce that were tasty with the same mixed vegetables and rice,  The vegetables were steamed and needed to be dipped in the white sauce for more flavor.  The owner noticed we didn't eat much of the rice, which was good but I was watching my carbs, which I explained to him.  Desert consisted of a selection of cheesecakes for a nice finish.

data.title: Average Experience
data.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here based on the great reviews. The food was ok, nothing to write home about. My meal was a bit salty and his meal was a little lacking in flavor. The sodas were warm. The atmosphere was very casual and or server had a lengthy conversation with all to hear with a regular customer at the bar. She was very nice, and all smiles, however, with a four star rating I guess I expected a bit more. I wouldn't go back based on the experience we had.

data.title: Great little gem in Fall River!
data.text: Ive been there several times already and they never disappoint. Try the buffalo chicken fries as a starter they are awesome! Had the chicken parm meal and its off the charts good, no place else in the area for classic Italian dishes. The grilled chicken sandwich and Mozambique are also yummy! CAV has the total package. The food, service & atmosphere are all there.

data.title: Hidden Pleasure
data.text: Great food and Service. This is and addition to the one I sent on Monday or Sunday, I just wanted to add some photos, but the site won't let me!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: A Great Find!
data.text:
When we arrived, our party of 4 was seated right away, offered water & asked if we'd like some wine or one of their creative cocktail drinks. We ordered a bottle of wine & the CAV scallop appetizer. The scallops were heavenly & cooked just right! A basket of bread accompanied our water & wine, so of course, we dipped the bread in the sauce that was drizzled around our scallop appetizer!
The server was so personable, with a beautiful smile. She kept checking on us to make sure all was well with our orders. The bartender also came over a couple of times to ask if we were enjoying ourselves, and to see if we had everything we needed.  
Two of us ordered the shrimp scampi, one with linguini, the other with pene. The shrimp were a nice size and there were 6 to 8 shrimp, with the sauce tasting light with a wine and lemon flavor. I was happy i ordered the salmon, which had a delicous, light, but not over powering amount of a cream sauce around it. The salmon came with a choice of 2 sides, I chose mashed potatoes, and the vegetable medley.  Our last friend chose the marinated steak tips, cooked medium rare, to his liking, with his 2 sides. We also ordered side salads with our meals, which were a nice size, and fresh.  We chose cheesecake for dessert with a fruit compote design over it which was very tasty.
The atmosphere was quiet, relaxing, with a beautiful window view of city hall. We arrived after 7:00pm on an early fall evening, but had it been a summer night, we could have enjoyed a dring and an appetizer on their front patio,which I am sure would have been lovely.
The dining room had about 12 tables, covered with white table cloths which gave it a somewhat elegant flair.  The bathrooms were very clean, and well stocked.
All in all, our night out at CAVs Restaurant was delightful and delicious. We will certainly return again, soon!
